channel.title: Which Antiforms Are In Use?
channel.description:
As an aid for myself, I made a summary table:
| Type | Antiform | Usage | Stable? | |--|--|--|--| | word! | **KEYWORD!** | Special constant values (e.g. ~null~, ~okay~) | ✓ | | group! | **SPLICE!**| Values without surrounding block (empty is BLANK) | ✓ | | frame! | **ACTION!** | Trigger function execution from words | ✓ | | fence! | **DATATYPE!** | Description of a value's type | ✓ | | rune! | **TRASH!** | Unset variables, can hold message on why unset | ✓ | | block! | **PACK!** | Multi-returns from a function (empty is VOID) | **✗** | | comma! | **GHOST!** | Discarded by evaluator when function *only* returns ghosts | **✗** | | warning! | **ERROR!** | Failure signal, elevated to panic if not triaged | **✗** |

item.title: Which Antiforms Are In Use?
item.dc:creator: hostilefork
item.description:
2 posts were merged into an existing topic: Antiform Explanations

item.title: Which Antiforms Are In Use?
item.dc:creator: hostilefork
item.description:
bradrn:

As an aid for myself, I made a summary table

Very useful!!!

(and has been useful as a place for me to update it over time, to look at how it shapes up and makes sense!)

Do note that the %types.r table (WIP version) encodes the type/antiform information as well: Such as for splice:

group       "list that evaluates expressions as an isolated group"
~splice~    "fragment of multiple values without a surrounding block"    
            (node1)
            [any-series? any-sequencable?]

And for error:

warning     "context with id, arguments, and stack origin"
~error~:U   "error state that is escalated to a panic if not triaged"
            (node1 node2)
            [any-inert?]

(The :U means the antiform is "unstable".)

In any case, %types.r is a pretty good example of dialecting! As much as possible, it's good to use Rebol to do code generation for properties in the C (and also to put in the binary for HELP)!

%types.r has come a long way since R3-Alpha!

This is what it looked like in R3-Alpha:

github.com/rebol/rebol

src/boot/types.r

25033f897 

      
    
          
  1. 	email       self        string      +        f*      *      *   [series string]  
    2. 
          
  2. 	url         self        string      +        f*      file   *   [series string]
    3. 
          
  3. 	tag         self        string      +        +       *      *   [series string]  
    4. 
          
  4. 
          
  5. 	bitset      self        bitset      *        *       *      *   -
    6. 
          
  6. 	image       self        image       +        +       *      *   series
    7. 
          
  7. 	vector      self        vector      -        -       *      *   series  
    8.

A much better strategy has been implemented for specifying granular dispatch, so the last vestiges of weirdness of things like self string + f* file * are gone:

Read full topic

item.title: Which Antiforms Are In Use?
item.dc:creator: bradrn
item.description:
As an aid for myself, I made a summary table:

Type Antiform Usage Stable?
word! KEYWORD! Special constant values (e.g. ~null~, ~okay~) ✓
group! SPLICE! Values without surrounding block (empty is BLANK) ✓
frame! ACTION! Trigger function execution from words ✓
fence! DATATYPE! Description of a value's type ✓
rune! TRASH! Unset variables, can hold message on why unset ✓
block! PACK! Multi-returns from a function (empty is VOID) ✗
comma! GHOST! Discarded by evaluator when function only returns ghosts ✗
warning! ERROR! Failure signal, elevated to panic if not triaged ✗

Read full topic
